intro: Elynanthus punctorius, commonly known as the puncture vine, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, round, spiny fruits that contain one or two seeds each. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Elynanthus punctorius is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a common weed in disturbed soils.
